data.text: @runrobinrun73 @samolden1 @CPandRuk @PhysiosForME It's funny I was just talking to another LC sufferer and said I never got PEM in legs always upper body. Changing beds and showering takes alot out of me. Or lifting my granddaughter. I will give this a go.

@Kelsveil @samolden1 @CPandRuk @PhysiosForME It’s part of the Long Covid assessment @CPandRuk 
https://t.co/BvfYS9qkxe
@Kelsveil @samolden1 @CPandRuk @PhysiosForME 55% of 176 is 97bpm. You’ll find that many arm tasks raise it more than going for a walk. Shaving was harder work for me than walking on the treadmill
@runrobinrun73 @samolden1 @CPandRuk @PhysiosForME Is there an actual lactate threshold test privately someone can take?

@runrobinrun73 @samolden1 @CPandRuk @PhysiosForME Thanks! So for me that would be 220-44=176-55%? That would leave me about staying at 80bpm which would be for me just lifting the kettle to poor tea. Maybe I'm not calculating correct?

@RL_MHnurse @SessionsTlc @LongCOVIDPhysio Sorry to hear this Richard. I’m now working in a post Covid service and seeing so many different presentations that have such an impact on the individuals involved
@Kelsveil @samolden1 @CPandRuk We did it through a sub maximal exercise test. The information from @PhysiosForME on heart rate monitoring is very useful and what we based our work on
@runrobinrun73 @samolden1 @CPandRuk How can I find out my lactate threshold? My crash is always in the 2nd day too.

@runrobinrun73 @SessionsTlc @LongCOVIDPhysio Not sure if you've ever seen our story, read my blog or anything. My wife had 10 weeks in hospital with covid19 she's not been at work since December 2020, its a blend of long covid and ITU deconditioning.

@runrobinrun73 @Running_Charity You’re doing so well and an absolute trooper!! We would love to see you back when the time is right for you. Thanks for all the time and support you’ve given to the charity and our runners over the years. Take care 🙏
